main event: Multiple witnesses reported sightings of unidentified aerial objects over Union and Cincinnati, Ohio on June 5, 1949.
interesting points: An observer described the object as dull white, shaped like an artist's palette, appearing at a 45-degree angle, and disappearing at a 35-degree angle., A separate witness saw a greyish-brown sausage-shaped object that climbed vertically, reversed course, and flew out of sight., Witnesses estimated the sizes of the objects varied between 2 feet and 30 feet in diameter., Witnesses reported the objects flying at approximately half the speed of a jet and observed in clear weather conditions., The sightings were corroborated by multiple civilians in different locations, enhancing the credibility of the reports.
witness description: Civilian observers including a housewife and a project engineer.
